messages.message:
Hi all -- PSA from the crafting folks:

`webpack` is leaking a lot of memory in some sandboxes. This is a `webpack` issue, not a crafting issue, but it can cause memory problems in sandboxes, so we should all be aware.

We have set the max heap size (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/blob/b5bb8164e4b396ff904adc9708a7112a8cb04195/webserver/shared/src/js/webpacked/package.json#L236) for `webpack` already, but it doesn't seem to always be working. If you notice `webpack` is using too much memory (look at `top` to see), or if your sandbox is really super slow (due to swapping) -- restart it, until we can figure out why webpack is doing this:

```cs restart webpack```
Hopefully we can get off `webpack` and onto `vite` at some point anyway; that might also solve the problem.

cc @Serena in case you have any ideas (no action needed)
@William Helmratha Ashish mentioned you’ve been thinking about dev tooling issues - has the migration to vite been on your radar? Definitely less important than the nodejs upgrade though
Yep this is definitely something I want to do but probably won’t get to until Q3
At the very least running the dev server w/ vite and then still using webpack for production builds
